metadata.name: Use of Pcalua For Execution
metadata.comment: Detects execition of commands and binaries from the context of The program compatibility assistant (Pcalua.exe). This can be used as a LOLBIN in order to bypass application whitelisting.

batch.sql: SELECT * FROM process_activity WHERE time BETWEEN CURRENT_TIMESTAMP() - INTERVAL 24 HOUR AND CURRENT_TIMESTAMP() AND (lower(activity_id) = lower('1') AND endswith(lower(process.name), lower('\\pcalua.exe')) AND contains(lower(process.cmd_line), lower(' -a')))

output.summary: Detects execition of commands and binaries from the context of The program compatibility assistant (Pcalua.exe). This can be used as a LOLBIN in order to bypass application whitelisting.

metadata.objective: False positive: Legitimate use by a via a batch script or by an administrator. References: https://lolbas-project.github.io/lolbas/Binaries/Pcalua/, https://pentestlab.blog/2020/07/06/indirect-command-execution/
